Articles.Content:
New MK5 Exosuit. Stock parts only. First Exosuit in the series thats SSTO capable. Lots of hardpoints for weapons. Also has a sombrero.

![exosuitmk5_zpsxqoxvbed.jpg](http://i508.photobucket.com/albums/s321/Khobai/exosuitmk5_zpsxqoxvbed.jpg)

[Exosuit MK5.craft](https://www.dropbox.com/s/5k2kysbi4qrw960/Khobai%20Exosuit%20MK5.craft?dl=0)

Control Groups

1= Turbojet Engines

2= Nuke Engine 

3= Ion Engines (use in space only)

4= RCS Engines

5= Fire Rocket Claw

6= Fire Rocket Claw

7= Ladder

8= Solar Panels (use in space only)

9= Fire Sombrero (eject this when its out of fuel)

10= Deploy Parachutes

Make sure you turn on SAS! 

Sombrero supplies the extra fuel required to make orbit. Can be ejected when it runs out of fuel or to increase performance if youre just flying around KSP. Also its very difficult to land so I recommend using the parachutes.

Evolution of design:

MK1 Exosuit (capable of space flight only, single ion engine and RCS)

![exosuit_zpsa8e8c0ef.jpg](http://i508.photobucket.com/albums/s321/Khobai/exosuit_zpsa8e8c0ef.jpg)

MK2 Exosuit (capable of space flight only, dual ion engines and RCS)

![exosuit2_zps6a659316.jpg](http://i508.photobucket.com/albums/s321/Khobai/exosuit2_zps6a659316.jpg)

MK3 Exosuit (first atmospheric flight capable Exosuit, jet engine, dual ion engines, and RCS)

![exosuitmk3_zpsf550390f.jpg](http://i508.photobucket.com/albums/s321/Khobai/exosuitmk3_zpsf550390f.jpg)

MK4 Exosuit (not pictured, but was basically just the MK3 with a detachable jetpack for SSTO)

MK5 Exosuit (pictured above, SSTO capable, x2 turbojets, x1 nuke engine, dual ion engines, dual RCS engines, and RCS thrusters.)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-24T19:52:44Z" title="03/24/2015 07:52  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 24, 2015</time> by Khobai**
OMG dude, the second one is hilariously awesome! Please give IR a go and make that thing walk. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> OMG dude, the second one is hilariously awesome! Please give IR a go and make that thing walk.

Its definitely something Id like to experiment with. Are there any good videos/tutorials on making a bipedal walker with IR?

> 
> Its definitely something Id like to experiment with. Are there any good videos/tutorials on making a bipedal walker with IR?

Have a look through these:

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93953-Biped-Cam-Operated-Walker-Tutorial-w-Advanced-Techniques-Stock-Infernal-Robotics](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93953-Biped-Cam-Operated-Walker-Tutorial-w-Advanced-Techniques-Stock-Infernal-Robotics)

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/69593-Infernal-Propulsion-Challenge-Walkers-catapults-and-more!-Infernal-Robotics](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/69593-Infernal-Propulsion-Challenge-Walkers-catapults-and-more!-Infernal-Robotics)

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93815-BIPEDAL-WALKING-CONSTRUCTION-ROBOT-now-available-for-download?p=1416336#post1416336](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/93815-BIPEDAL-WALKING-CONSTRUCTION-ROBOT-now-available-for-download?p=1416336#post1416336)

And have a look through this guys posts: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/search.php?searchid=4801379](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/search.php?searchid=4801379)

MJ
The second one looks like a Harridan from Xenonauts!
